channel.title: CNN.com - Top Stories
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2015 Cable News Network LP, LLLP.

image.title: CNN.com - Top Stories
image.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

item.title: Malaysian PM confident; French prosecutor less certain
Family member: 'I can't speak'
item.description: K.S. Narendran, whose wife was aboard missing Malaysia Airlines Flight 370, may be more confused now than ever.

item.title: What next?
item.description: Could a small portion of a plane wing discovered on an Indian Ocean island be the clue investigators need to unlock one of aviation's biggest mysteries?

item.title: What happened to MH370?
item.description: "Good night Malaysian three-seven-zero." It was a routine sign-off, an all-is-well.

item.title: Gunman in theater hatchet attack shot dead
U.S. airmen die in freefall training
item.description: Two special tactics airmen died after a freefall training accident at Eglin Air Force Base in Florida, the Air Force said.

item.title: Gadhafi's son beaten on tape
item.description: A nine-minute video surfaced online this week showing what appears to be Libyan prison guards abusing one of the sons of former Libyan dictator Moammar Gadhafi.

item.title: Hostage threat in 'ISIS video'
item.description: In a video purportedly released by ISIS on Wednesday, a group claiming to be ISIS' branch in the Sinai Peninsula threatens to kill a Croatian hostage if Egypt doesn't release female Muslim prisoners in 48 hours.

item.title: Stephen King's idea for Trump
item.description: Author Stephen King slammed Republican presidential candidate Donald Trump on Wednesday, suggesting the GOP frontrunner is running a racist campaign.

item.title: Dozens killed as trains veer off bridge
NY escapee 'drunk' when shot
item.description: Richard Matt -- one of two convicted murderers who escaped from a New York prison in June -- was drunk at the time of his death, toxicology reports show.

item.title: Donald Trump calls for 'civil' debate
item.description: As GOP frontrunner Donald Trump has made news all summer for attacking members of his own party, the real estate mogul promised that would be "very civil" at the first Republican presidential debate of the cycle Thursday.

item.title: Boy, 11, charged over tot's death
item.description: An 11-year-old boy has been charged after being accused of using his father's gun to shoot and kill a 3-year-old boy in Detroit.

item.title: Report: 'El Chapo' clues ignored
item.description: Clues that Joaquin "El Chapo" Guzman was plotting a prison break were seemingly all around, but Mexican officials chose not to act, according to a leading investigative reporter.

item.title: Wedding plans under water
item.description: CNN's Sumnima Udas meets a newlywed couple trying to stay hopeful amid massive floods in eastern India.

item.title: Pope on divorce: No closed doors
item.description: Pope Francis on Wednesday called for a more open Church -- one that embraces people who are divorced and remarried and their children.

item.title: Typhoon eyes Taiwan, China
item.description: Typhoon Soudelor, while no longer strong enough to be classified as a super typhoon, remained a powerful cyclone Wednesday that is taking direct aim at Taiwan and China, threatening damaging winds, destructive storm surge and flooding rainfall.

item.title: The world's highest paid actor is ...
item.description: Robert Downey Jr. has been named the world's highest paid actor for the third year in a row by Forbes, thanks in no small part to the power of the Chinese box office.

item.title: China + math Olympiad = rare U.S. victory
item.description: For the first time in 20 years, China has lost a world math championship to the United States -- and many in the world's most populous nation seem happy about it.

item.title: Athletics at 'war' over doping
item.description: The world of athletics is at loggerheads with two leading media organizations over just how widespread doping is within the sport, following reports that nearly 150 medal-winners at major championships produced "suspicious" blood tests.

item.title: Free frog: Kermit cuts pig loose
item.description: Gavin and Gwen. Reba and Narvel.

item.title: New Dubai complex: Huge, snowy and record-breaking
Parading Pride where homophobia is rife
item.description: A year after the anti-homosexuality bill was nullified, Uganda's LGBTI community embark on four days of Pride events.

item.title: North Korea adventure by rail?
item.description: What's the worst reaction you could possibly get when you tell your friends you're going to North Korea?

item.title: Tourists sneak selfie with monkey
item.description: Take a look at 26 selfies of the week from July 29 through August 4.

item.title: This airport runs on wind
item.description: The Galapagos Islands are among the most environmentally precious -- and sensitive -- regions on earth. Airports, by contrast, tend to leave a pretty disastrous carbon footprint. It should come as no surprise that the Galapagos is also home to what has been hailed as the world's first "green" airport.

item.title: Psychedelic world of Indian truck art
item.description: If you're going to spend 10 months of the year on the road, you'd want a pretty sweet ride.

item.title: A ride with diamond eyes: The first Arab supercar
7 food magicians who'll melt your mind
World's first unstealable bike?
item.description: Three young entrepreneurs claim to have solved a problem that makes every cyclist's blood boil -- they have invented the world's first "unstealable" bike.

item.title: Kelly Osbourne's Trump slam backfires
item.description: Kelly Osbourne made some controversial comments of her own when discussing Donald Trump's recent statements on Latinos.

item.title: How to create holograms from your phone
Body painter makes models disappear
item.description: Artist Trina Merry camouflages her human canvases into their surrounding scenery and can create mesmerizing shapes out of multiple people.

item.title: She lied. He's paying for it
Growing up is hard but these photos are beautiful
Inside Navy's 'most lethal warship'
item.description: Get a closer look at the Navy's newest submarine, the USS John Warner.

item.title: Cold War-style battle of the soccer billionaires
Huntress defiant over exotic kills
item.description: Far from cowering, keen Idaho hunter Sabrina Corgatelli has been flaunting her kills, posting verses from the Bible apparently to justify her hunting ways.

item.title: Cazorla: We can beat the big teams
A new swinging style: 'You can't go too crazy'
What a shot! 40 amazing sports photos
item.description: Take a look at 40 amazing sports photos from July 28 through August 3.

item.title: The island with 70 beaches and one huge volcano
The city where romance travels by rail
item.description: Travel's romantic spirit lives on in the French capital's grandest railway terminals.

item.title: Blur's Damon Albarn brought to life in comic
'Hell full of beautiful women, no mirrors'
Photographer finds beauty in imperfection
item.description: Dutch photographer Hellen van Meene has been working over the last 20 years to capture a defining moment in every person's life.

item.title: 7 ways to spot someone is being trafficked
Opinion: The myth of child prostitution
item.description: Last week saw the premiere of "Children for Sale: The Fight to End Human Trafficking," which exposes the hidden realities of child sex trafficking in the United States. It's a powerful documentary. But there's even more to the story.

item.title: Countries ranked: Who's fighting trafficking?
item.description: Cuba, Kenya and Saudi Arabia are doing better at fighting human trafficking. Egypt, Ghana and Bulgaria are doing worse.

item.title: 13,000 flee Rocky Fire
item.description: 13,000 residents evacuate areas of Northern California as the Rocky Fire rages on.

item.title: Ride along with an ex-convict
item.description: He was once a member of a notorious Hong Kong gang, now this ex-convict is finding hope behind the wheel of a taxi.

item.title: Syrian refugees struggle to reach Hungary
item.description: Arwa Damon reports on the plight of migrants in Hungary in this CNN exclusive.

item.title: Incredible smartphone holograms
item.description: Find out how to turn your smartphone into a thing of a future.

item.title: Woman has carried fetus for over 60 years
item.description: Doctors in La Boca, Chile, made a startling discovery when they realized 91-year-old Estela Meléndez had been carrying a calcified fetus for over six decades.

item.title: Touching this plant can blind you
item.description: Officials discovered giant hogweed plants growing in Michigan. Touching them can cause bruising, burning or even blindness. CNN affiliate WWMT reports.

item.title: Drawings show haunting memories of Hiroshima
The island with 70 beaches and one huge volcano
Why Iran deal is good for Israel
How America got polarized
item.description: As my wife and I waited to see a screening of "Best of Enemies," a new documentary focusing on the debates between the conservative publisher William Buckley Jr. and the liberal author Gore Vidal in the summer 1968, I overheard another guest say, "It will be nice to see a movie about a time when television was so much better at the news than it is today."

item.title: Hiroshima: What Obama should say
item.description: Thursday marks the 70th anniversary of the first use of atomic weapons, when the Japanese cities of Hiroshima and Nagasaki were hit by atom bombs that ultimately claimed hundreds of thousands of lives, and left tens of thousands more injured and suffering the effects of radiation.

item.title: Beirut's 1960s jet-set playgrounds
item.description: For several decades the name "Beirut" has conjured images of devastation and danger.

item.title: Buildings on verge of destruction
item.description: Go see them now, before it's too late: threatened by neglect, the elements, changing architectural trends or ruthless developers, these outstanding buildings are all fighting a hard battle for survival.

item.title: World's 10 most scenic airport approaches
item.description: For jaded air travelers, window seats are overrated.

item.title: Ruins of the Soviet space shuttle program
item.description: What was once the gleaming pride and joy of the Soviet space program now lies covered in dirt and bird droppings in a disused hangar in Kazakhstan.

item.title: NASA finds 'Earth's bigger, older cousin'
item.description: NASA said Thursday that its Kepler spacecraft has spotted "Earth's bigger, older cousin": the first nearly Earth-size planet to be found in the habitable zone of a star similar to our own.

item.title: 10 watches that changed history
item.description: Mechanical watchmaking is not a world of revolutions, it's a world of evolutions, where change comes only slowly and tradition is a sacred trust. In the five hundred or so years that watches have existed, however, there have been a few that have changed the watchmaking world. Some of these watches broke new ground in design, some in technology -- and some both. Here are ten that made history and became part of it at the same time.

item.title: Girl from Vietnam War photo: Where is she?
item.description: Even without the benefit of context, the image of a naked 9-year-old girl running for her life is as searing and indelible today as it was 43 years ago.

item.title: Capturing beauty around the world
item.description: To photographer Mihaela Noroc, beauty cannot be defined by one country, race or ethnicity.

item.title: The homeowners who refused to budge
